Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin K Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Amount to be determined within 60 days.
12/02/2015 AMENDED: $195.00 IN RESTITUTION IS TO BE DISBURSED THROUGH THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S TRUST ACCOUNT.

records.addlTxt: regarding restitution.

Defendant Dustin K Johnson not in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Restitution set at $195.00 and defendant has paid.  
Court orders $195.00 restitution.
7/28/15 Letter to Judge Babler from DA Beranek requesting a restitution hearing.
Restitution hearing at 11-20-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Dustin K Johnson in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State moves to amend to State Disorderly Conduct 947.01 a Class B Misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.
Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge.  Court finds defendant guilty.

$100 fine plus costs.  

(Restitution to be determined within 60 days)
